Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Intraarticular Fibrinogen in Total Knee Arthroplasty

Trial_Design.evidence: 200 patients undergoing TKA for osteoarthritis were randomised

Intervention.evidence: randomised to receive either intraarticular fibrinogen or no treatment

Objective.evidence: This study evaluates the effect of intraarticular fibrinogen on bleeding and transfusion requirements post-TKA.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was postoperative blood loss, measured by drain output and hemoglobin drop at Day 2.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was computer-generated, and allocation was concealed.

Blinding.evidence: Patients, clinicians, and outcome assessors were blinded.

Number_Randomised.evidence: 100 patients were randomised to each group. Recruitment occurred between January 2020 and June 2021.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Mean drain output was 780 ± 378 mL in the fibrinogen group and 673 ± 301 mL in the control group (p = 0.029).

Harms.evidence: Adverse events were similar between groups.
